title: Southern Pecan Pie II
description: Experience the rich, buttery sweetness of this classic Southern pecan pie, a treasured recipe passed down through generations. With its flaky crust and luscious pecan filling, this pie is perfect for any gathering or cozy night in.
ingredients: ½ cup butter, chilled and diced
instructions: In a large bowl, combine 1 ½ cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt.
Cut in the chilled butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Mix the egg yolk with ice water and stir into the flour mixture until it forms a ball.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight.
Roll out the dough and place it into a 9-inch pie plate.
Place pecan halves evenly in the bottom of the pie crust.
In a large bowl, stir together ¾ cup sugar and 2 tablespoons flour.
Add eggs, corn syrup, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract; blend well.
Pour the filling mixture over the pecans in the crust.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350°F (175°C) and bake for an additional 40 to 50 minutes, or until the filling is set and the crust is golden brown.
Allow the pie to cool completely before serving to let the filling set.
tips: For a perfectly flaky crust, keep your butter cold and avoid overworking the dough. Bake until the filling is just set—overbaking can cause cracking. Let the pie cool fully to achieve the ideal sliceable texture.

structured_content.content: This Southern Pecan Pie II is a timeless dessert that delights with its buttery crust and rich, nutty filling. The sweet aroma of pecans and vanilla fills your kitchen as it bakes, promising a slice of Southern hospitality in every bite.

structured_content.content: I first tasted this pie at a family reunion, where the warm, nutty sweetness instantly brought everyone together. It’s a recipe that carries memories and the joy of sharing something truly special.

• Main ingredient: Pecans provide a rich, buttery crunch that is essential for authentic flavor and texture. Use fresh halves for the best presentation.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Vanilla extract adds warmth and depth, while light corn syrup creates the perfect sweet, gooey filling.
  • Supporting ingredients: Butter ensures a flaky crust and adds richness to the filling; eggs help bind the pie filling together.
  • Equipment needed: Mixing bowls, pie plate, rolling pin, and an oven capable of precise temperature control.

Preparation:
Combine dry ingredients and cut in cold butter until crumbly. Add egg yolk and ice water to form dough. Chill for at least 1 hour to relax gluten and firm the butter.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Roll out dough and line pie plate. Arrange pecans evenly. Mix filling ingredients thoroughly and pour over pecans. Bake first at high heat to set crust, then lower temperature to cook filling until golden and set.
Finishing Touches:
Cool completely to allow filling to firm up for clean slices. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream for an indulgent finish.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Start baking at high temperature to set the crust quickly and prevent sogginess
  • Avoid overbaking to prevent cracking and dryness in the filling
  • Look for a golden crust and a filling that jiggles slightly but is not liquid
  • Store leftovers covered at room temperature for up to two days or refrigerate; reheat gently if desired

structured_content.content: Sharing this pie with loved ones always brings a sense of warmth and celebration. It’s more than just dessert—it’s a slice of tradition and togetherness.
Enhance the pie by adding a pinch of cinnamon or a splash of bourbon to the filling for a subtle spice and depth. Toast the pecans lightly before adding for extra crunch and aroma.

Serve warm or at room temperature with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream. Pair with a cup of strong coffee or sweet tea for a true Southern experience. Ideal for holiday dinners, potlucks, or cozy weekend treats.

For a gluten-free crust, substitute all-purpose flour with a gluten-free blend. Vegan versions can use coconut oil in place of butter and a flax egg instead of eggs, though texture will vary slightly. Add chocolate chips or dried fruit for a unique twist.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Keep butter and water ice-cold to ensure a flaky crust
  • Mix filling ingredients gently to avoid incorporating too much air, which can cause cracks
  • Bake on the middle rack for even heat distribution
  • Brush crust edges with egg wash for a shiny, golden finish
